Posts.Content: On 7/25/2008 Chrissie Lou wrote: I have not heard of Chondroid cartilage, but I was diagnosed with Metaplastic Carcinoma in my right breast in March of this year.  Since then I have had 6 rounds of chemotherapy using TAC.  I am now finished with chemo and the original tumor, which was 5 cm, has reduced in size by more than half.  Although the tumor reduced enough to be eligible for a lumpectomy, my husband and I (along with the breast surgeon's agreement) decided that it would be best for me to go ahead and do a bilateral mastectomy.  I am scheduled for surgery in a few weeks. I will still need radiation because of the original size of the lump.   Like you, I had a very hard time finding information specific to metaplastic carcinoma.  None of the multitude of books I read had anything about it.  The only place I found information was through the Internet and that was lacking, too.  Some of the things I read were very discouraging and then other items I read resulted in good survival rates.  After getting totally frustrated I finally had to tell myself that each case is different and I really didn't know all of the facts so I couldn't compare myself to them.  I'm just me and I plan to beat this and be a long-term survivor!  This discussion board has been the most interesting to me because at least I know there are a few people out there with the same type of cancer who were just as confused and lacking information as I was. I had to put all my faith and trust in my team of doctors, who have been wonderful. Personally, I have responded very well to chemo and was not too bothered by the side effects.  Being 48 years old and in pretty good shape, along with a positive outlook has helped me get through these past 4 months without too much trouble.   It sounds like your tumor is pretty small and you caught it early, which is great!  I hope that can find the answers you are looking for and that all goes well with your treatment.  Please feel free to keep in touch with me, ask questions, or just vent your feelings if you need to through this discussion board. I've been there, am still in the process of being there, and am willing to help you in any way I can! I wish you the best. Chris Hi Chris   I have not heard of Chondroid Cartilage/Metaplastic Carcinoma. But I did and I will keep it in the past tense : ) Last year 10/07 also right breast lumpectmy chemo 35 radiation 6 with boost.  Being a survivor means never giving uo.  Best of everything fight embrace being a SURVIVORsharon

Posts.Content: On 1/24/2008 terrib wrote: My name is Terri and I just found this website.  I was diagnosed in April 05, with one tumor, and a Mastectomy and was told that chemo wouldn't be effective  with this type of cancer. I WAS with M.D. Anderson in Houston.  Two and a half years later, I found a lemon size tumor in my buttocks, and when they scanned me, they found one in my lung and one in my neck.  I did chemo (FAC) from September, and December 26th was my last one.  I got scanned a week later where nothing showed up.  I pray that it doesn't return and have been doing the cancer diet since September (lots of mushrooms, berries, and greens, and of course NO SUGAR).  I am now with Baylor, Dr. Kent Osborne, an amazing doctor for anyone looking for one.  If you google his name with Baylor after it, you can read a hundred of his websites,  He knows a lot about Triple Negative Cancer, which I have; I don't know if all of us with Metaplastic have Triple Negative.   Is Taxol recommended afterwards?  I have an appointment January 31 and I guess I'll find out the gameplan then, but at this point the plan is to keep monitoring me every two to three months. I am 45 with 5 kids and a great, supportive husband. Please e-mail me if anyone has any other info on this. Thanks! Terri - --Message edited by CancerCompass staff. For personal protection, email address removed. Consider private reply. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html--   I was diagnosed with metaplasic breast cancer in Oct 2007. I had a lumpectomy 11/27/07. In Dec I started Chemo adriamycin &cytoxan every other week to be followed by taxiol chemo for 4 weeks and then radiation (4) treatments. I have not met or talked to anyone with our diagnosis HER/2  or HER/3. Medical Science does not seem to know what exactly to do with us : )  I am 58 yrs old with 2 adult children and a husband  i have known since the age of 12yrs old. I would like to be around to see grandchildren. I wish you luck. If there are more  (METAPLASTIC BREAST CANCER) LADIES I WOULD LOVE TO HEAR YOUR STORIES SINCE OUR CONDITION IS SO RARE!!!
